resources.string: Torch mode is not supported by camera
Press to turn the flashlight off

Being the device administrator is required to turn the flashlight off with the Power button.\nYou can tap [Cancel] and control Open Flashlight Mini through its notification in the notification drawer.
We need the camera permission to manage the flashlight. If you reject permission, you can not use this application.\n\nPlease turn on camera permission at [Setting] > [Permissions]

Now we are the device admin! We can do anything with your device, muahaha! :-)\n\nIf you want to uninstall the application, first go to [Settings] > [Security] > [Device Administrators] and deselect Open Flashlight Mini.

Administrator rights has not been received.

Open Flashlight Mini will newer ask you to activate the Device Administrator in the future.
If you suddenly change your mind, open the System settings and reset the Open Flashlight Mini data to see the dialog again.
Tap the notification or press the Power button twice to turn the flashlight off.
If the app does not work correctly, please try Open Flashlight (not Mini). It uses the modern camera2 API and the Android Marshmallow permissions model.
